activities.title: Admission Process Incomplete (transcript received, not reviewed)
activities.summary: The Admissions Office has received, but not yet completed the review of your high school transcript.  This review must be completed and your high school graduation, or equivalent, verified before you can receive any federal aid.  Contact the Admissions Office to resolve this matter.

activities.title: Units less than half-time for fall - Cal Grant
activities.summary: Your Cal Grant cannot pay until you are enrolled at least half-time for the fall semester.

activities.title: Units less than half-time for spring - Cal Grant
activities.summary: Your Cal Grant cannot pay until you are enrolled at least half-time for the spring semester.

activities.title: Units less than half-time for fall - DL
activities.summary: Your Direct Loan will not pay until you are enrolled at least half-time for the fall semester.

activities.title: Berkeley Middle Class Access Plan (MCAP)
activities.summary: You are eligible for the Berkeley Middle Class Access Plan (MCAP).  Your Federal Parent Contribution is already lower than the MCAP limit of 15% of your total income, and your awards reflect this best option. To learn more about the Berkeley Middle Class Access Plan, please follow the link to the right.

activities.title: Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
activities.status: No action required, document reviewed and processed

activities.title: Verification Dependent
activities.summary: Your financial aid awards are not official because you were selected for Verification.  These estimated, conditional awards will not pay to your CARS account.  You must complete the Verification documents and submit them to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office with the required documentation.  If your verified household or financial information varies significantly from what you reported on your FAFSA, your awards are subject to change from your conditional offer.   The verification documents will be mailed to your permanent address.
activities.status: No action required, document reviewed and processed

activities.title: Eligible Non-Citizen Statement
activities.summary: You must verify your eligible non-citizen status by submitting the Eligible Non-Citizen Statement form with documentation.  This documentation must be submitted, in person, to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office.

activities.title: Selective Service Verification - CF
activities.summary: The Department of Education could not confirm that you are registered with Selective Service.  We must verify that you are registered, or are not required to register, before we can award you financial aid.  You can register or confirm your registration on the Selective Service website at http://www.sss.gov/ or by calling 888-655-1825.  Once you have documentation of your registration status, submit it with the Selective Service Verification form.

activities.title: Social Security Number Certification
activities.summary: Your Social Security number did not match the information on file with the Social Security Administration.  You must submit the Social Security Number Certification form to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office in order to receive financial aid.

activities.title: FAFSA Dependency Status Change
activities.summary: We were notified that you updated your FAFSA with new information that resulted in a change to your dependency status.  You must complete the FAFSA Dependency Change form and submit the requested documentation to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office.

activities.title: FAFSA Income or Asset Change
activities.summary: We were notified that you updated your FAFSA with new information that resulted in a change to your Expected Family Contribution (EFC).  You must complete the FAFSA Income or Asset Change form and submit the requested documentation to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office.
activities.status: No action required, document received not yet reviewed

activities.title: FAFSA Household Change
activities.summary: We were notified that you updated your FAFSA with information that resulted in a change to your (or your parents') household size, number in college, and/or marital status.  You must complete the FAFSA Household Information Change form and submit the requested documentation to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office.
